description: illuminated page; words in a tan script along L side of page; floral arabesque drawn in a thin strip along R side in blue and gold with red details
medium: Tempera, gold leaf, and pen and ink on vellum
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: This leaf probably comes from a prayer book produced in France in the 1400s. It contains several appeals the Virgin Mary. Before or after each one is the expression “Ave Maria,” meaning “Hail Mary.”
title: Ave Maria
